definition: value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty

sentences.english: The stock market is forward looking, reflecting the current value of future expected after-tax profits.
sentences.chinese: 股市是向前看的，反映的是未來預期稅後收益的現值。

sentences.english: The cash equivalent valuation is the product of "asset future benefit".
sentences.chinese: 資產現值計價是資產“未來經濟利益觀”的產物。

sentences.english: Their task is to maximize net present value.
sentences.chinese: 經理人的任務就是最大化淨現值。

sentences.english: The objective function of the optimization is the saving present value per unit heat consumption during the calculation period.
sentences.chinese: 目標函數爲計算期內單位供熱量的節約額現值。

sentences.english: Equalizing rate of return The rate of return that equalizes the present value of two streams of costs.
sentences.chinese: 平衡收益率指使兩組成本流的現值相等的收益率。

sentences.english: In consideration of this, the author holds that to calculate net present value break-even point is necessary.
sentences.chinese: 鑑於此，筆者認爲有必要計算現值盈虧平衡點。

sentences.english: Agreeing discount rates to calculate NPV (Net Present Value);
sentences.chinese: 商定計算淨現值的折算率。

sentences.english: Therefore, the present value of the property is also its marketprice.
sentences.chinese: 因此，這棟辦公樓的現值也是它的市場價格。
